info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 21 at 3:14PM EDT until August 21 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville FL
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of northeast Florida, including the following counties, Duval and Nassau.
* WHEN...Until 600 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 314 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Jacksonville, Fernandina Beach, Jacksonville International Arpt, Arlington, Unf, Jacksonville Beach, Atlantic Beach, Yulee, Neptune Beach, Oceanway, San Marco, Riverside, Fort Caroline, Craig Field, Cisco Gardens, Nassau Village-Ratliff, Normandy, Ratliff, Ortega and Talbot Island. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EDT THIS EVENING
